p: First, most major classes of pathogens have evolved agents that are capable of being transmitted by blood-feeding arthropods: viruses (e.g., yellow fever virus, Rift Valley fever virus), rickettsiae ( Rickettsia rickettsii, R. typhi), bacteria ( Borrelia burgdorferi, Francisella tularensis), protozoa (genera Plasmodium and Leishmania), and helminths ( Onchocerca volvulus, Wuchereria bancrofti). Fungi seem to be the only category not represented.
